pathAssistantSteps.info:
The 'Contract' stage signifies that the client has accepted the proposal and is ready to formalise agreement with a Contract with QUT.

Use the Contracts Lifecycle Management System (CLMS) to create and manage the contract process.
This ‘Identify’ stage enables you to capture the opportunity with a new or existing industry partners to support research and research training initiatives.

This ‘Project Scoping’ stage allows you to capture the project scope, viability analysis.

Once, the project scoping and viability is completed proceed with proposal initial drafting, distribute your Proposal for internal review, feedback, and/or to the client for review and acceptance. Use the Proposal Status' and 'Summary’ field to capture the status and key information around the proposal.

This ‘Submitted’ stage confirms that a Proposal or tender is submitted awaiting response.

Use the Proposal Outcome and comments field to record the outcome of the Proposal Stage.
